Dating: 23RD DYNASTY (not before); 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not after)
Name: Canopic jar with lid in the shape of a human head
Description: The body, with narrow shoulders, tapers slightly towards the bottom. The rim of the vessel is horizontal, as is the bottom, but not smoothened. The inside has been hollowed out until about halfway down.Lid : the smooth wig completely frames the broad face but does not cover the ears. The eyebrows and the eyes, with long cosmetic line, are carved in low relief and were painted black. On the underside of the lid is a very flat protrusion, which is roughly polished.
